website_summaries.verdict: Extra padding makes these steps comfortable for all pets. Easy to move from room to room with lightweight design.
pros: Washable cover allows steps to continue looking great
Customers love performance level with low price point
Handle on back of steps enhances portability feature
cons: Corrugated cardboard design may not hold its shape over the long run
Product is almost too light, causing some stability issues for larger animals

customer_reviews.title: very strong and the right height
customer_reviews.text: This is very strong and the right height for my 2 Yorkie's to climb on to get on and off the bed. Like the cardboard box idea for it makes it light. Had one before that was made of foam and it started sagging after sever years. Sorry about the messy bed, it is a Tempur-pedic on the adjustable base. Not too many to chose from that were high enough, needed at least 4 steps.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Curry

customer_reviews.title: Good for toy breed or cats I guess
customer_reviews.text: This is for up to 150lb dogs? This thing looks like it was made for a cat. No large or even medium sized dog would get on this thing. Picture is very misleading. I opened it, saw how tiny it was and put it right back in the box to ship back. I know buying stuff online can be tricky and this is why. I ordered the biggest one by the way
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, not as described.
customer_reviews.text: Was so disappointed when I got these. It says the stairs are padded, there was zero padding on them. The cover is loose & that scares me cause I have 2 senior chihuahuas & if the cover moves when they are going up or down them it could cause them to loose their footing & fall. Almost 2 feet is a long ways for a small dog to fall! I just received these today & will be returning them as soon as possible. I gave them 2 stars, 1 for being light weight & 1 cause it did only take 1 day for me to get them.
customer_reviews.author: djb

customer_reviews.title: great steps for our dog
customer_reviews.text: These steps work great for our dog. They were a bit intimidating for her at first. They are narrow and the fabric moves on the steps when she gets on them. Once she got used to them, that wasn't an issue anymore, she bounds right up them. Going down took a little more time to get used to. With patience, these have been great! We don't have to pick her up to get on the bed and I use them to get her into the jeep. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: patkt

customer_reviews.title: Our dog loves these stairs!
customer_reviews.text: These steps were a godsend for our older dog with arthritis. She can easily get onto the bed now, and it makes her so happy. The steps came all put together and ready to use, look nice, and are holding up well. They aren’t heavy but don’t slip on the hardwood floors yet are easy to move for ease of bedmaking. This was a great purchase and I couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Marcy K. ORourke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Little Dog!
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight, sturdy set of stairs for my little dog to climb up onto my bed. Whether your dogs little legs just make it hard to climb or for an aging dog, these steps are a great alternative for climbing from the floor to the bed. I am pleased with this product. Very sturdy, my dog is secure in climbing them. I recommend this product for higher than average beds or onto favorite furniture. Thank you from me and my little Wally!
customer_reviews.author: Linn Random

customer_reviews.title: Doggie independence!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 17-year old Jack Russell! It took me a few days of showing him how to climb up onto & down from the bed and couch but now he uses these religiously. And so he has been able to keep his independence regardless of his age or heart failure. The steps are also portable, so when I go to my parents house he’s able to get on their couch and beds without having to rely on anybody. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: toastedpeanut

customer_reviews.title: Great stairs for 2 out of 3 of my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stairs! All my daughter wanted for her birthday were stairs so the dogs could climb up to her bed. These stairs work great. Two out of 3 dogs were able to figure out how to climb up and down them. We did entice them with snacks, but now they don't even need encouragement to use them. I want a set of stairs for my bedroom too! The 2 that could figure it out area a terrier mix and an australian shepherd mix. The one who couldn't figure it out is a Havanese.
customer_reviews.author: Jean M. Gallant

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a returned product from the Amazon Warehouse. Mine is a cardboard structure. The interior structure was not secured all the way up and down, but nothing some glue can't fix. Supposedly holds 200lbs. I weight more than that so only stood on the bottom step, it held, lol. When I ordered I wasn't sure what kind of structure it would come with, but for 40 some bucks, I am cool with cardboard, it's a heavy duty structure. I have a chihuahua mix that uses them now, and as long as they don't get wet, they should be around when my shepard mix needs them in 8 years or so.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Well made, light weight.  Good product and price.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my blind Shih Tzu to get onto sofa. He learned quickly how to climb up; not so good with going down. This is not the fault of the steps. The cat likes to play on them too. It would work well for access to a bed too. I like that the steps are softly padded. Neither dog nor my toes will be injured if they bang into it.
customer_reviews.author: Liz H

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Had this a year already.and still.in great shape. I love the height. At 4 steps exactly.what I needed. Please be sure and handle.with care. Follow the weight.guidelines. The "stuffing is cardboard so quite flimsy. However I have a large Pug and a Chunky Rat Terrier and both manage well with these steps. I do have them against my bed.on one side since they are a little flumpsy. This helps.support it quite well. For the price and the fact that's its 4 steps I'm happy.with this purchase. If u are looking for something very sturdy this isn't it. But for 2 small dogs agai st a bed it works well
customer_reviews.author: Joyannmadd

customer_reviews.title: Stubborn dog wouldn’t use it
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality but not high end. Couldn’t get my little dog to use it. Tried every training trick to no avail. Figured I’d just leave it and let her get used to it. Nope. She ran around and jumped off time and again. Gave up after two weeks. Rather than return it I gave it away. That person’s old cat won’t use it either. It doesn’t slip on hard wood floors though. Worth trying. Save the tags and box just in case you need to return it. If I could have gotten my dog to use it I would have given it four stars.
customer_reviews.author: vlw

customer_reviews.title: Big, clunky, and I love it to pieces
customer_reviews.text: Big, clunky, and I love it to pieces. I imagine how different my purchasing experience would have been if I bought cheaper, plastic, folding. This product is substantial, in the way, easy to trip over. But it is sturdy and inspires confidence. Highly recommended. Enjoy watching your pet climb these with ease :)
customer_reviews.author: Rory James

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Loves Her Stairs!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect thing we needed. Our dog needed tore her labrum, and after she was allowed to move freely, she was was hesitant to jump onto our bed, to her "spot". We got tired of lifting a 75lbs dog. My wife bought this product and once Lucy got the hang of it, she now uses her stairs all the time. It has been 6 months now. Awesome Product.
customer_reviews.author: Woof

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but..

customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our 3 legged cat

When we unpacked the box, she immediately ran up the steps onto the bed. One corner had minor damage but not very noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R

customer_reviews.title: NIce steps
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 15 1⁄2 with a little arthritis issues. She needed steps for both the couch and bed. At first I thought they would not work as the steps are very narrow, and she fell down the first two times (though going up is no problem). With a little help with her, she now maneuvers them fine. They are a little wobbly if you move the steps by hand, but the cover is nice and also washable. Overall they work and I am happy. Good price & fast shipping. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Shoshaunna

customer_reviews.title: No complaints

The steps are wide enough, and the fact that they are covered is great. I had originally bought another brand, and the steps were too narrow, and not carpeted. My dog did not like those ones. He will run up and down these ones. So all in all these were a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Aluise

customer_reviews.title: Very unsafe - Not sturdy

My dog only weights 16lbs and it didn’t work Out for us at all.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.

I've got an extra tall bed, but my old lady (the dog) is just fine with the last step being a little higher than the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great steps for chihuahuas

Great steps

customer_reviews.title: Still using after purchasing >2 yrs ago!

For us we never used the step direction that is higher, too tippy and steep.
customer_reviews.author: minnesotagrl03

customer_reviews.title: So sturdy! It could support 150 pounds

customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great for older cats but younger ones like it too.

customer_reviews.author: Melissa Cortez
